service:
The AWS Chatbot API Reference provides descriptions, API request parameters, and the XML response for each of the AWS Chatbot API actions.

AWS Chatbot APIs are currently available in the following Regions:

  • US East (Ohio) - us-east-2

  • US West (Oregon) - us-west-2

  • Asia Pacific (Singapore) - ap-southeast-1

  • Europe (Ireland) - eu-west-1

The AWS Chatbot console can only be used in US East (Ohio). Your configuration data however, is stored in each of the relevant available Regions.

Your AWS CloudTrail events are logged in whatever Region you call from, not US East (N. Virginia) by default.

operations.AssociateToConfiguration: Links a resource (for example, a custom action) to a channel configuration.
operations.CreateChimeWebhookConfiguration: Creates an AWS Chatbot configuration for Amazon Chime.
operations.CreateCustomAction: Creates a custom action that can be invoked as an alias or as a button on a notification.
operations.CreateMicrosoftTeamsChannelConfiguration: Creates an AWS Chatbot configuration for Microsoft Teams.
operations.CreateSlackChannelConfiguration: Creates an AWS Chatbot confugration for Slack.
operations.DeleteChimeWebhookConfiguration: Deletes a Amazon Chime webhook configuration for AWS Chatbot.
operations.DeleteMicrosoftTeamsChannelConfiguration: Deletes a Microsoft Teams channel configuration for AWS Chatbot
operations.DeleteMicrosoftTeamsConfiguredTeam: Deletes the Microsoft Teams team authorization allowing for channels to be configured in that Microsoft Teams team. Note that the Microsoft Teams team must have no channels configured to remove it.
operations.DeleteMicrosoftTeamsUserIdentity: Identifes a user level permission for a channel configuration.
operations.DeleteSlackChannelConfiguration: Deletes a Slack channel configuration for AWS Chatbot
operations.DeleteSlackUserIdentity: Deletes a user level permission for a Slack channel configuration.
operations.DeleteSlackWorkspaceAuthorization: Deletes the Slack workspace authorization that allows channels to be configured in that workspace. This requires all configured channels in the workspace to be deleted.
operations.DescribeChimeWebhookConfigurations: Lists Amazon Chime webhook configurations optionally filtered by ChatConfigurationArn
operations.DescribeSlackChannelConfigurations: Lists Slack channel configurations optionally filtered by ChatConfigurationArn
operations.DescribeSlackUserIdentities: Lists all Slack user identities with a mapped role.
operations.DescribeSlackWorkspaces: List all authorized Slack workspaces connected to the AWS Account onboarded with AWS Chatbot.
operations.DisassociateFromConfiguration: Unlink a resource, for example a custom action, from a channel configuration.
operations.GetMicrosoftTeamsChannelConfiguration: Returns a Microsoft Teams channel configuration in an AWS account.
operations.ListAssociations: Lists resources associated with a channel configuration.
operations.ListCustomActions: Lists custom actions defined in this account.
operations.ListMicrosoftTeamsChannelConfigurations: Lists all AWS Chatbot Microsoft Teams channel configurations in an AWS account.
operations.ListMicrosoftTeamsConfiguredTeams: Lists all authorized Microsoft Teams for an AWS Account
operations.ListMicrosoftTeamsUserIdentities: A list all Microsoft Teams user identities with a mapped role.
operations.ListTagsForResource: Lists all of the tags associated with the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that you specify. The resource can be a user, server, or role.
operations.TagResource: Attaches a key-value pair to a resource, as identified by its Amazon Resource Name (ARN). Resources are users, servers, roles, and other entities.
operations.UntagResource: Detaches a key-value pair from a resource, as identified by its Amazon Resource Name (ARN). Resources are users, servers, roles, and other entities.

AccountPreferences.base: Preferences related to AWS Chatbot usage in the calling AWS account.

refs.GetAccountPreferencesResult$AccountPrefe: The preferences related to AWS Chatbot usage in the calling AWS account.
refs.UpdateAccountPreferencesResult$AccountPr: Preferences related to AWS Chatbot usage in the calling AWS account.

refs.ListTagsForResourceRequest$ResourceARN: The ARN of the resource to list tags for.
refs.UntagResourceRequest$ResourceARN: The value of the resource that will have the tag removed. An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) is an identifier for a specific AWS resource, such as a server, user, or role.

refs.AssociationListing$Resource: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource (for example, a custom action).

refs.ListAssociationsResult$Associations: The resources associated with this channel configuration.

AssociationListing.base: A listing of an association with a channel configuration.

refs.SlackUserIdentity$AwsUserIdentity: The AWS user identity ARN used to associate a Slack user ID with an IAM Role.
refs.TeamsUserIdentity$AwsUserIdentity: The AWS user identity ARN used to associate a Microsoft Teams user Identity with an IAM Role.

refs.AccountPreferences$UserAuthorizationRequ: Enables use of a user role requirement in your chat configuration.
refs.AccountPreferences$TrainingDataCollectio:
Turns on training data collection.

This helps improve the AWS Chatbot experience by allowing AWS Chatbot to store and use your customer information, such as AWS Chatbot configurations, notifications, user inputs, AWS Chatbot generated responses, and interaction data. This data helps us to continuously improve and develop Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies. Your data is not shared with any third parties and is protected using sophisticated controls to prevent unauthorized access and misuse. AWS Chatbot does not store or use interactions in chat channels with Amazon Q for training AI technologies for AWS Chatbot.

Turns on training data collection.

This helps improve the AWS Chatbot experience by allowing AWS Chatbot to store and use your customer information, such as AWS Chatbot configurations, notifications, user inputs, AWS Chatbot generated responses, and interaction data. This data helps us to continuously improve and develop Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies. Your data is not shared with any third parties and is protected using sophisticated controls to prevent unauthorized access and misuse. AWS Chatbot does not store or use interactions in chat channels with Amazon Q for training AI technologies for AWS Chatbot.

A description of the webhook. We recommend using the convention RoomName/WebhookName.

For more information, see Tutorial: Get started with Amazon Chime in the AWS Chatbot Administrator Guide.

refs.CreateCustomActionRequest$ClientToken:
A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Idempotency ensures that an API request completes only once. With an idempotent request, if the original request completes successfully, subsequent retries with the same client token returns the result from the original successful request.

If you do not specify a client token, one is automatically generated by the SDK.

ConfiguredTeam.base: A Microsoft Teams team that is authorized with AWS Chatbot.

CustomAction.base: Represents a parameterized command that can be invoked as an alias or as a notification button in the chat client.

refs.CreateCustomActionRequest$AliasName: The name used to invoke this action in a chat channel. For example, @aws run my-alias.
refs.CustomAction$AliasName: The name used to invoke this action in the chat channel. For example, @aws run my-alias.
refs.UpdateCustomActionRequest$AliasName: The name used to invoke this action in the chat channel. For example, @aws run my-alias.

refs.CreateCustomActionResult$CustomActionArn: The fully defined ARN of the custom action.
refs.CustomAction$CustomActionArn: The fully defined Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom action.
refs.DeleteCustomActionRequest$CustomActionAr: The fully defined ARN of the custom action.
refs.GetCustomActionRequest$CustomActionArn: Returns the fully defined Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom action.
refs.UpdateCustomActionRequest$CustomActionAr: The fully defined Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom action.
refs.UpdateCustomActionResult$CustomActionArn: The fully defined ARN of the custom action.

CustomActionAttachment.base: Defines when a custom action button should be attached to a notification.

CustomActionAttachmentCriteria.base: A criteria for when a button should be shown based on values in the notification

refs.CustomActionAttachment$Criteria: The criteria for when a button should be shown based on values in the notification.

refs.CustomActionAttachmentCriteria$Operator: The operation to perform on the named variable.

refs.CustomActionAttachmentCriteria$Value: A value that is compared with the actual value of the variable based on the behavior of the operator.

refs.CustomActionAttachmentCriteria$VariableN: The name of the variable to operate on.

refs.CreateCustomActionRequest$Attachments: Defines when this custom action button should be attached to a notification.
refs.CustomAction$Attachments: Defines when this custom action button should be attached to a notification.
refs.UpdateCustomActionRequest$Attachments: Defines when this custom action button should be attached to a notification.

refs.CustomActionAttachment$NotificationType: The type of notification that the custom action should be attached to.

refs.CustomActionAttachment$Variables: The variables to extract from the notification.

refs.CustomActionAttachment$ButtonText: The text of the button that appears on the notification.

CustomActionDefinition.base: The definition of the command to run when invoked as an alias or as an action button.

refs.CreateCustomActionRequest$Definition: The definition of the command to run when invoked as an alias or as an action button.
refs.CustomAction$Definition: The definition of the command to run when invoked an alias or as an action button.
refs.UpdateCustomActionRequest$Definition: The definition of the command to run when invoked as an alias or as an action button.

refs.CustomActionDefinition$CommandText: The command string to run which may include variables by prefixing with a dollar sign ($).

refs.CreateCustomActionRequest$ActionName: The name of the custom action. This name is included in the Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
refs.CustomAction$ActionName: The name of the custom action that is included in the ARN.

refs.CreateSlackChannelConfigurationResult$Ch: The configuration for a Slack channel configured with AWS Chatbot.
refs.UpdateSlackChannelConfigurationResult$Ch: The configuration for a Slack channel configured with AWS Chatbot.

refs.CreateSlackChannelConfigurationRequest$S:
The ID of the Slack channel.

To get this ID, open Slack, right click on the channel name in the left pane, then choose Copy Link. The channel ID is the 9-character string at the end of the URL. For example, ABCBBLZZZ.
refs.SlackChannelConfiguration$SlackChannelId:
The ID of the Slack channel.

To get this ID, open Slack, right click on the channel name in the left pane, then choose Copy Link. The channel ID is the 9-character string at the end of the URL. For example, ABCBBLZZZ.
refs.UpdateSlackChannelConfigurationRequest$S:
The ID of the Slack channel.

To get this ID, open Slack, right click on the channel name in the left pane, then choose Copy Link. The channel ID is the 9-character string at the end of the URL. For example, ABCBBLZZZ.

Tag.base:
A key-value pair. A tag consists of a tag key and a tag value. Tag keys and tag values are both required, but tag values can be empty (null) strings.

Do not include confidential or sensitive information in this field.

For more information, see User-Defined Tag Restrictions in the AWS Billing and Cost Management User Guide.

refs.UntagResourceRequest$TagKeys: TagKeys are key-value pairs assigned to ARNs that can be used to group and search for resources by type. This metadata can be attached to resources for any purpose.

refs.CreateCustomActionRequest$Tags: A map of tags assigned to a resource. A tag is a string-to-string map of key-value pairs.
refs.ListTagsForResourceResponse$Tags: Key-value pairs that are assigned to a resource, usually for the purpose of grouping and searching for items. Tags are metadata that you define.
refs.TagResourceRequest$Tags: A list of tags to apply to the configuration.

refs.ConfiguredTeam$TenantId: The ID of the Microsoft Teams tenant.
refs.ConfiguredTeam$TeamId:
The ID of the Microsoft Teams authorized with AWS Chatbot.

To get the team ID, you must perform the initial authorization flow with Microsoft Teams in the AWS Chatbot console. Then you can copy and paste the team ID from the console. For more information, see Step 1: Configure a Microsoft Teams client in the AWS Chatbot Administrator Guide.
